results.title: Job No. 1112
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Dahl Collings, Geoffrey Collings and Collings Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the engineering design of the roof of the Sydney Opera House and the development of the architectural form of the roof from the original concept to its final realisation. Shows the construction of the roof with details of many special techniques developed to cope with its unusual building problems. Narrated by Ron Haddrick.

results.title: The Fire brigade
results.creator_credit: Joan Boundy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of training a young recruit in every aspect of his duty as a fireman attached to a large metropolitan fire brigade. Equipment is demonstrated in detail, including its actual use in a spectacular city fire.

results.title: Farewell to charms
results.creator_credit: Carla Pontiac, Carole Sklan and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An experimental feminist film which questions the goals of love and romance as a woman’s ultimate fulfillment. Emma, vivacious but suicidal terrorist is reunited with Cecily, her old school chum. They meet a ‘bionic bike dyke’ called stretch and break open the jelly beans. Will they stretch a point over the pool table? Will tap-dancing and vaginal exercises be enough for Cecily? Will Emma metamorphose into Esther Williams? True romance. Cast includes Radda Jordan, Helen Pankhurst.

results.title: Dartmouth
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dartmouth Dam, on the Mitta Mitta River in Victoria, has been designed to manage the waters of the River Murray for irrigation and urban needs. This film tells the story of the making of Dartmouth Dam including the study of plant and animal life. Reminiscences about the old Dartmouth township, and plans for the new town of Dartmouth. Narrated by Simon Chilvers.

results.title: Children's Theatre
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, John Morris, Lilias Fraser and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Children at the Studio Theatre in Adelaide study painting, music and speech as part of their training in ballet. This is a Children’s Theatre for children and by children. Classes and rehearsals, planning and teaching precede the performance of an Australian ballet, telling the story of an Australian aboriginal legend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Bagnall, John Morris, Lilias Fraser and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian by design
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: The manufacture of Australia’s own car from the initial design on a drawing board to the completed vehicle as it comes off the assembly line. Precedence is given to safety in both design and engineering. Rigorous tests are carried out at Lang Lang testing track which incorporates all types of road conditions. In creating an automotive industry G.M.H. has stimulated the nation’s industries and economy.

results.title: Anzac
results.creator_credit: Jennie Blackwood, Adrian Boddington and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Historical photographs and early newsreels tell the story of the Gallipoli assault; embarkation and transport of 75,000 men in 200 ships from Egypt to Gallipoli; initial landing below cliffs; building a jetty and digging in; main British attack at Cape Helles and subsequent assaults on the heights; hardships, casualties and final evacuation. Commentary by Moray Powell and Peter Carver.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jennie Blackwood, Adrian Boddington and Zanthus Films

Commentary by Moray Powell and Peter Carver.

results.title: Admission impossible
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Chris Oliver and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The very first Act passed by Australia’s first parliament was a law to exclude non-white races from Australia. “Admission impossible” is the true story of the behind-the-scenes political forces and propaganda that created the infamous White Australia Policy which was enforced until 1972. Eyewitness accounts and recently discovered confidential documents reveal how immigration officers carried out racial selectivity to discriminate against Asians, Jews and non-European applicants. The last part of the program discusses the impact the Vietnam War had on the reversal of this policy.

results.title: After hours
results.creator_credit: Jane Campion, Australian Film Commission, Film Australia and Women's Film Unit
results.brief_description: Dramatized situation of an office worker who alleges sexual abuse when asked to stay back late to finish some typing. She loses her job as a result of her claims. Both her fellow workers and boyfriend fail to understand her situation, somehow blaming her for what happened. The investigator for the case finds difficulty in obtaining evidence from people associated with the manager. Cast: Danielle Pearse, Don Reid, Anna-Maria Monticelli, Russell Newman.

results.title: After Cook
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A look at the Australian people, their character, attitudes, and way of life. Australians, in the city and the bush, are examined both at home and while enjoying their favourite pastimes. Note: A short version of 28 minutes, intended mainly for overseas viewers, was also produced, entitled ‘Everything under the sun. Commentator: John Meillon.
